meanings.definition: To adjust or adapt to a new climate or environment.
meanings.sent1: After moving to the mountains, she had to acclimatise to the thin air.
meanings.sent2: It takes time to acclimatise to the hot weather in the desert.
meanings.sent3: Trying to acclimatise to the freezing cold by wearing shorts was not a smart idea.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a plant trying to acclimatise to a new pot, struggling to find its place.
meanings.sent5: The birds acclimatise to the changing seasons by migrating south for the winter.

meanings.definition: To become accustomed to a new situation or surroundings.
meanings.sent1: The new student needed to acclimatise to the school's schedule.
meanings.sent2: It can be challenging to acclimatise to a different work environment.
meanings.sent3: He tried to acclimatise to the noisy city by wearing earplugs everywhere.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a fish out of water, trying to acclimatise to the fast-paced lifestyle.
meanings.sent5: The puppy acclimatised quickly to its new home, wagging its tail happily.
